Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior reserved band at rim (top lost), glazed streaky dark brown below; part of a lotus flower in added white outline with trace of added red centre; exterior: at bottom of sherd, painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on either side of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style vases is not usually extensive. Furthermore, the rims on some vases of this style are not decorated, unlike those of other styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0932) (phase 2)
